title: British Airways says goodbye: No tears are shed
text:
British Airways says goodbye: No tears are shed Adv: 
By Prof. Dr. Wolfgang H. Thome, Ph.D., eTN Africa Correspondent | Jul 24, 2015 Adv: 
When the news came in earlier this morning that British Airways, after months of denying the rumors, had finally confirmed their intent to halt flights from London to Entebbe, the reaction was swift and brutal. 
"They took us for fools. The writing was on the wall for quite some time after they ditched Dar es Salaam. British Airways had everything going for them in the 90s and could have, in fact should have, gone daily way before the likes of Emirates came into Entebbe. But they diddled and fiddled around and instead cut their representation back. Even the top guy moved from Nairobi to South Africa. It is just like with getting visa to Britain, their High Commission too shifted this out of Uganda. I can only say good riddance, they made a mess of things instead of grabbing market opportunities. No one is shedding a tear here I tell you," ranted a periodic contributor from among the top-ranked travel agencies in Kampala, who by admission hardly sold BA any longer and had shifted his passengers to the Gulf airlines for long-haul flights. 
The last flight from Heathrow to Entebbe will take place on October 2 and the return flight will subsequently leave Uganda back for the UK on October 3.
